DStoreSet(address,uint256).details: Emitted when a value is stored.

params.forwarder_: The address of the trusted forwarder

returns._0: true if forwarder_ is trusted forwarder

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._value: The uint8 value to be stored

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

constructor.notice: Constructor to set the trusted forwarder

isTrustedForwarder(address).notice: Check if the given address is the trusted forwarder

storeValue(uint8).notice: Function to store a uint8 value

storedBy().notice: Address of the entity that stored the value

userdoc.notice: This contract serves as a sample data storage decentralized application (DApp). It allows users to store a uint8 value along with the address of the entity performing the storage operation. To prepare a contract for DPlat compatibility: 1. Users are required to derive from the abstract contract called ZbyteContext. 2. Replace the usage of msg.sender with _msgSender() and msg.data with _msgData().
